TopicTitle: About "The Dev's said..." Posts and Threads

Articles.Content:
Stop it. Just, stop it. It's against forum rules to claim a feature is coming/completed/going to be added, with out directly quoting a reference from a post made by a KSP developer. I've seen a lot of, "The Dev's said" posts lately and well, just stop it.

-DR

With developers like these, no matter what is in the next update, it will be good. Proven fact.

(Shouldn't this be locked?)
This the exactly the reason why the devs need to post what their up to... as long as it isn't secret.

This the exactly the reason why the devs need to post what their up to... as long as it isn't secret.

They don't do it because they might be working on something that won't be in the next update. Updating a status would be too time consuming.

I still don't see why people could have problems with the update when it's not even out yet...

This the exactly the reason why the devs need to post what their up to... as long as it isn't secret.

The devs don't need to do anything short of provide the next version when they deem it ready. To think you can demand they tell you what they are doing is pure hubris.

Now, before this thread devolves into a flame fest, it's being closed.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
